author: Nouvelles
title: 8 Pages ‚Äì Duplantis participe au 100 m√®tres
text:
Le Norv√©gien Karsten Warholm affrontera le Su√©dois Armand Duplantis ce mercredi soir. Photos : TT
Le su√©dois Armand Duplantis
et le Norv√©gien Karsten Warholm
sont tous deux des stars des Jeux olympiques.
Duplantis d√©tient le record du monde de saut √† la perche.
Warholm d√©tient le record du monde
au 400 m√®tres haies.
Mais maintenant, ils doivent rivaliser les uns avec les autres.
Ils courront 100 m√®tres.
La comp√©tition a lieu ce soir, mercredi,
√† 21h30
√† Zurich en Suisse.
Duplantis et Warholm sont amis.
C‚Äôest Duplantis qui l‚Äôa invent√©
l‚Äôid√©e de concourir sur 100 m√®tres.
Il pensait que ce serait amusant
pour voir lequel d‚Äôentre eux √©tait le meilleur
en courant 100 m√®tres.
Quand Duplantis √©tait plus jeune
il a couru 100 m√®tres
en 10,57 secondes.
Warholm a d√©j√†
a couru en 10,49 secondes.
Mais Armand Duplantis croit toujours
qu‚Äôil peut vaincre Warholm.
‚Äì Ma seule pens√©e est que je vais gagner,
dit Duplantis.
Diffusions du site Aftonbladet
directement de la concurrence.
Regardez Duplantis et Warholm s‚Äôaffronter
La radio su√©doise diffuse √©galement en direct
dans l‚Äô√©mission Radiosporten
dans le canal P4.

author: News Agency Of Nigeria
title: UK firm commends Tinubu for appointing Aliyu as NNPCL board director
text:
UK firm commends Tinubu for appointing Aliyu as NNPCL board director
Lucas said as Aliyu embarks on this new chapter, the TEXEM family is confident that he will bring the same passion, intellect, and foresight that have defined his career thus far.
Recommended articles
In a statement on TEXEM‚Äôs website, www.texem.co.uk, its Director, Special Projects Caroline Lucas said Aliyu, an alumnus of TEXEM UK, have participated in its programme ‚ÄúStrategic Leadership For Success in an Unknown Tomorrow‚Äù designed for the Tax Appeal Tribunal.
Lucas said the bespoke initiative, held from May 15 to 19, 2023, equipped participants with the strategic foresight needed to navigate the complexities of an ever-changing future characterised by geopolitical risks and a slowing global economy.
She said the new appointment conferred by President Bola Tinubu, is a testament to Aliyu‚Äôs exceptional leadership journey.
‚ÄúBefore assuming this pivotal role, Prof. Almustapha Aliyu distinguished himself as a Tax Appeal Federal Commissioner, serving on the Tax Appeal Tribunal with other erudite professionals.
‚ÄúHis commitment to fairness, diligence, and a profound understanding of fiscal matters made him an invaluable asset to the Tax Appeal Tribunal.
‚ÄúHowever, Prof. Aliyu‚Äôs journey to the boardroom is marked not just by his contributions to tax appeals but also by his relentless pursuit of knowledge and leadership excellence,‚Äù Lucas said.
She said that Aliyu‚Äôs commitment to leadership extends beyond the corporate realm as his roots lie in academia.
‚ÄúBeginning his career as an academician, he quickly emerged as a thought leader in public sector accounting.
‚ÄúHis contributions to the field, coupled with his role as a faculty member at Usmanu Danfodiyo University, Sokoto, demonstrate a commitment to nurturing the next generation of leaders.
‚ÄúAs Prof. Aliyu assumes his role on the board of NNPCL, we anticipate a confluence of academic wisdom, fiscal acumen, and strategic vision,‚Äù Lucas said.
According to the TEXEM director, the appointee‚Äôs multidimensional background positions him uniquely to contribute to the sustainable growth and success of the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited.
Lucas said that Aliyu is among individuals who in the ever-evolving realm of leadership, not only navigate change but also steer organizations toward success with unwavering dedication and expertise.
‚ÄúTEXEM UK takes immense pride in having Prof. Almustapha Aliyu as part of its illustrious alumni network.
‚ÄúHis journey from academia to the tax sector and now to the corporate boardroom exemplifies the transformative impact of continuous learning and leadership development.
‚ÄúIn congratulating Prof. Almustapha Aliyu on this remarkable achievement, we celebrate not just an individual‚Äôs success but the embodiment of TEXEM UK‚Äôs commitment to shaping leaders who drive positive change in their respective spheres,‚Äù she said.
Lucas said as Aliyu embarks on this new chapter, the TEXEM family is confident that he will bring the same passion, intellect, and foresight that have defined his career thus far.
TEXEM UK‚Äôs founder, Dr Alim Abubakre also spoke on the new appointee.
‚ÄúIn the tapestry of leadership, Prof. Almustapha Aliyu stands as a beacon, weaving academia, fiscal acumen, and strategic vision.
‚ÄúHis journey, from academician to tax expert, culminating in the strategic role of Non-Executive Director at NNPCL, mirrors the transformative power of continuous learning.
‚ÄúBravo Prof. Aliyu ‚Äì your ascent is not just a personal triumph but a testament to TEXEM‚Äôs commitment to inspiring leaders who ignite positive change,‚Äù Abubakre said.
TEXEM was founded in 2010, with Microsoft in the UK being their first client, the organisation expanded to emerging countries following advice from the Lord Mayor of London and the British High Commissioner to Nigeria.

Jogos Ol√≠mpicos de Paris, nesta quinta-feira, 8. O ato foi considerado como uma apologia 'a supremacia branca' por alguns internautas.
-
A cobertura dos Jogos de Paris no Terra √© um oferecimento de Vale.
Enquanto aguardava a nota de Fanni, No√©mi fez o gesto com a m√£o direita: ela deixou 3 dedos para cima e conectou as pontas do polegar e do indicador. O sinal forma as letras W e P, letras iniciais de 'white power' (poder branco, em tradu√ß√£o livre para o portugu√™s).
O gesto repercutiu nas redes sociais. Internautas pediram que a Federa√ß√£o Internacional de Gin√°stica (FIG) investigue o caso. A FIG e o Comit√™ Ol√≠mpico Internacional (COI) ainda n√£o se pronunciaram sobre o caso.
hey FIG what youre gonna do about this? Noemi Gelle should be banned, this is absurd!!!!‚Äî lucas (@luludebabalong)

Ela formou com os dedos as letras W e P, se referindo a White Power.

author: Samantha York (NEWS CENTER Maine)
title: 'Every Brilliant Thing' brings audience members closer to the magic on stage
text: PORTLAND, Maine ‚Äî If you've ever wanted to experience the magic of live theater up close and personal, "Every Brilliant Thing" at The Public Theatre in Lewiston is the show for you. The one-woman show features actress Tarah Flanagan in the lead role, although that character is not named. Despite tackling some pretty tough subject matter, like depression and suicide, Flanagan said the show is a comedy and there really is something for everyone. What makes the production unique are the audience members that will line the stage throughout the entire performance, some of which will even be asked to join Flanagan in telling the story. Here's part of our conversation with Flanagan about the show ahead of opening night: Samantha: Why is the show called "Every Brilliant Thing? Tarah: Our lead character in the play, her mother, is suffering from depression when she is young. And, because she is little, she thinks that the way to help her mother is to catalog a list of every brilliant thing she can think of in the world. Small things, funny things, absurd things. That is her childlike way of seeking to help her mother but, in doing so, it helps her connect with everything that is beautiful about the world. Samantha: The audience is actually part of the show as well. Tell me a little bit about that. Tarah: First of all, I just want to let people know that it is not frightening. I am an introvert and if I were in an audience and an actor pulled me up on stage, I might be very, very nervous... You can participate or not participate to the degree that you are comfortable. You are always given a choice. We have chairs on the stage and we have chairs in the audience so we can all create community together. Samantha: Gratitude seems to be a keyword in the show and in what unfolds. Is there something specifically that you are grateful for? Tarah: Yes. The first time I worked on this play was six years ago. That was before COVID and I was really used to being in a room with people, really used to rehearsing in person, really used to being live and in person. I thought I was grateful for it, but there's nothing like having something taken away from you to realize how grateful you are for it... Getting to come back to this story with a new sense of how important it is to gather in community... I'm so grateful. The show runs Jan. 24 through Feb. 4, tickets are still available. Click here for pricing and showtimes. For more local stories continue with us on our NEWS CENTER Maine+ streaming app. For the latest breaking news, weather, and traffic alerts, download the NEWS CENTER Maine mobile app.
